cyclone.name: OPHELIA
cyclone.current_location: about 120 mi SE of Cape Fear, NC
cyclone.trajectory: Ophelia is tracking north-northwest tonight, forecast to make landfall on the North Carolina coast early Saturday, then sweep north-northeast across eastern North Carolina, southeastern Virginia (including Hampton Roads) and the Delmarva Peninsula through Sunday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: North Carolina coast (Surf City–Cape Lookout area)

weather_observation.under_warning: Tropical Storm Warning, Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch confined to NC coast north of Surf City to Ocracoke Inlet (does not include Virginia).
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Cape Fear, NC to Fenwick Island, DE, including Chesapeake Bay south of North Beach and the Tidal Potomac south of Cobb Island; Storm Surge Warning from Bogue Inlet, NC to Chincoteague, VA including Chesapeake Bay south of Colonial Beach.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Eastern North Carolina through southeastern Virginia and the lower Chesapeake Bay, then northward to the Delmarva coast.
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm-force winds 40–50 mph with higher gusts likely Saturday, diminishing late Saturday night.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft inundation possible in lower Chesapeake Bay and Hampton Roads, including the port complex.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with isolated totals up to 7 inches could cause flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; a few tornadoes possible Saturday.
